To our customers.

Of the business.

In this presentation I would like to introduce you with with some of the development that have been done in Zambia Health Insurance Company.
As a as a business case, so to say how this is how these technologies are used in our company.
And I hope that this will be of help also to you.
First of all, I would like to introduce the company itself Xemnas.
1st and largest voter heart insurance company in Slovenia.
It is organized as a mutual insurance company.
That means that the members of the company, so the ones that hold our insurance policies are really the owners of the company.
We have around 900,000 members.
That means that we held around 60% of the private health insurance market with the annual.
Premium income of approximately 250 million euros.
And for the last few years we have been very active in business and I would like to 1st introduce you with our activities on the business and then how these activities can can be used.
With the security that we have put in place to enable our customers also to do issues of eHealth.
Of course, when we ask ourselves what is, what is the business I I would say that probably everybody has its own on definition.
One can view a business is a very limited, very limited issue.
As a matter of communication between.
Order date undertakings or the exchange of information and data.

Of course one can see businesses everything that is used or any any interaction that is done by electronic means or somewhere in between how we defined it is is really that we treat as E business everything that is in between our core applications and are outside world and by outside world I mean the service providers, the medical service providers that we work with.
The insurance partners that means the insureds and the companies that insure.
With our company and also other businesses or the government.

With.
With E business we also mean in this sense.
The close projects that we work there or we have done previously with.
With other partners, one of this which has just recently, we was just recently finished is the project that was done by Health Insurance Institute.
And it is called.
Online health insurance.
Online health insurance is is very interesting project, not just for Slovenia but also for other countries because it is.
It is one of the best and.
Biggest implementations of of the business.
What is the whole point of this project?
It is really.
It is enabling anybody in Slovenia to use their health cart to access data.
About health insurance in Health Insurance Institute and in all three health insurance companies that are private health insurance companies that are providing health insurance.
But first I would like to say.
Some information about E business that we have done previously.
We have divided our E business efforts into few steps.
First steps was really to connect.
Our information system with the information systems of all the medical health providers we have introduced the electronic bill and the Portal for exchange of digital digital documents.
This portal, of course, provides the infrastructure for digital signatures.
And we currently received around 50,000 electronic bills.
From more than 1700 partners in this way.
This eportal really enables us to replace the electronic bills and other documents with electronic documents, and part of this electronic documents already already digitally digitally signed.
Unfortunately, currently just 10% of medical service providers use really portal and use the paperless communication with all the others.
We still use both both ways, so that means that they send us the electronic documents, but unfortunately not digitally signed and therefore they have to send us paper bills as well.
What we have learned and what was at least for us.
Very good experience is that it takes some time to switch to a business, not because of internal matters of the company that you want to do it, but because you have to persuade all the partners.
That is something that that brings.
Lower costs in and easier.

Exchange of data and information also to them it is much easier if you are in a position that you can enforce that certain companies that are big enough can enforce that, or the government itself can enforce that.
For example, already mentioned project of online health insurance that are performed by Health Insurance Institute in Slovenia was was enforcing all the.
Participants to really join the project and to change the way they.
They do the business, but if you are a company that is not in such such a position, it can take some time.
It can take even some years, so when somebody decides to do it, it has to take that in account.
The return on investment here is not as as fast as everybody might want.

But anyway, if you if a company wants to really do a major business with the majority of their partners, it is very important to use the standards and to try to introduce those standards also to other partners that might join such a scheme.
In future in Slovenia, for example, each insurance company, each health insurance company, provided its own starting standards and in its own solutions.
And of course this increased costs for everybody.
And and also was a factor that really made the introduction of new solutions.

Harder.
But based on the experience that we had within the introduction of.
Any business.
All three health insurance companies here in Slovenia finally agreed on the same standards.
Now we have defined 2 standard.

One is for the documents itself and one is for the exchange of the documents so that the back end systems of health service providers can interact with the back end systems of the insurance companies using the same protocols and using the same tools.

We are now in the implementation of these protocols with with some of the service health service providers, and we believed that in this year we will be able to exchange the information in such a way with several hundreds of health insurance.
Providers here in Slovenia.
Um?
As I already mentioned, the introduction wasn't was unfortunately, gradual because we were not in a position to enforce this kind of interaction with with other companies that we work with.
But to really move, at least internally to such type of processes.

We have introduced a great granule, gradual approach in a sense that all other paper documents that we received we first transfer into electronic form and then use the same processes for all our documents, no matter whether those are electronic at the inputs are or paper.
This way we produced our process around 2000 bills a year, 200,000 bills a year.
With 13 two 5215 million records, this is the number of claims that we that we handle, and this is the number of records that we exchanged with the medical service providers in Slovenia.
Tronic Lee.

After the first phase, we wanted to introduce the 2nd and the third phase, the third phase, the second phase being the development of the business with the companies that insure with us and the third phase being the.
In short itself so that we would be able to provide different types of.
Electronic Interchange or access to their data in our databases or in other databases that we can access.

But after seeing that the process is very slow, we have decided really to focus ourselves on in shorts and also to proceed with with projects that we can do with the government or the E government services.
One of these was the electronic communication with the cord that we have introduced in 2008 and we currently handle 20,000 active files.
In paperless.
Form.
Of course, moving to electronic documents brings brings its own problems, especially the issues of storage and security.
First of all, we have had to comply with the legislation regulating the digital signatures in digital timestamps.
This is a regulation that was introduced in Slovenia very early and and the law itself was at that time.
Superior to majority of other laws, but of course it it also put some stress on the companies that wanted to introduce it.
Becausw there were no.
Software tools available at that time.
When we when we really started to use it.
But what we have, what you have to have in mind when you start with such a project, is that you really have to use the the infrastructure for as much processes as you can.
So to lower the costs and to make the implementation quicker.
When I say that you have to handle in somehow storage of the paper documents, that means also the documents that you produce and send out in the paper form.
But you want to be able to give access to these documents to your clients.
What we want to do is really to provide the access for our insurance to those documents, and we now's store them in electronic form.
We currently produce more than, for example, 2 1/2 million bills a year alone which are now in electronic form in our databases and in our Electronic Document management system.
We can't currently handle 8 million documents and those are the documents that we want now to also impart open to our partners.
Of course, this brings its own new issues of of of insecurity.
The digital signatures alone and and evidence of the axis is not enough is not enough.

We have introduced in our database systems also the database world which provides us that even the administrators of the system cannot access the secure personal health data that are held in our records.
But what would be what we would like to do in the future is to give.
Access to this data to the insurance via Internet and also to connect this data with the data that is in health records at health service providers, like in hospitals or in other facilities.
Now, a lot of data is already in electronic form, but it is the citizens are not really able to access that data.
There are several ways how this can be handled.
There are there are some state projects in Slovenia that that are introducing this kind of of concepts and and the preparation of the portal is also in place that will bring health records too.
To citizens.
But there are also other initiatives.

One of initiatives that we are currently working on working on with with partners is a resource research projects where we check really whether our infrastructure is good enough so that it would allow our insurance our members to access through our secure infrastructure, the medical data.
There is that that are really at service service providers medical service providers.

With a secure infrastructure communication between all the partners, we can provide this access to our members.
This is challenging if you have like 1000 companies that you have to work with to provide this.
This kind of service.
Currently we of course in a pilot project, so we want really 1st to check the concept and see whether this concept.

Gives good results so that the Members would be able to really access their records and then when we check this then of course each Member will have to decide whether in what way he will he will access this.
This records we have learned as I said previously, that we cannot really expect.

That a lot of people will decide to check their data regularly, but in several countries, even here in Europe such kind of interaction at least being able being able to look into the the services that have been provided to you.
Is enforced by by, by law, and in this way people are really able to get to their data and to see what kind of services have been provided and what higher kind of data is available for them.
And of course in the future they will be able to give the access to this data even just one time access to, for example, Doctor the day visit.
We believe that with the the underlying security with the infrastructure that is, that is secure enough and with the knowledge of.
Um?
Of everybody in.
The interconnected sorry with the knowledge of all the interconnected businesses.
How to handle this data securely.
We will be able to give access to E held data and move from the business to E Health in the next few years.
Thank you.
